About Cursors


The cursor position is key to comfortably set complex nested structures. The following rules apply:




The cursor position is always set relative to the current one, unless the field name starts with the 
.
 character. Fields can be nested such as in 
-r f.s.o
 .


The cursor position is set relative to the top-level structure if it starts with 
.
, e.g. 
-r .s.s


You can also set nested fields without setting the cursor explicitly. For example, to set a value relative to the current cursor position, you would specify 
-r struct.sub_struct=bar
.


You can move the cursor one level up by using 
..
. Each additional 
.
 moves it up one additional level. E.g. 
...
 would go three levels up.




Optional Output Flags


The method's return value a JSON encoded structure, which will be written to standard output by default.




-o out


out
 specifies the 
destination
 to which to write the server's result to.
  It will be a JSON-encoded structure.
  The 
destination
 may be 
-
 to indicate standard output, or a filepath that is to contain the received bytes.
  If unset, it defaults to standard output.








Optional Method Properties


You may set the following properties to further configure the call. Please note that 
-p
 is followed by one 
or more key-value-pairs, and is called like this 
-p k1=v1 k2=v2
 even though the listing below repeats the

-p
 for completeness.






-p timed-text-language=string




The language of the timed text.








-p timed-text-track-name=string




The timed text track name.








-p modified-date-behavior=string




Determines the behavior in which modifiedDate is updated. This overrides setModifiedDate.








-p convert=boolean




This parameter is deprecated and has no function.








-p use-content-as-indexable-text=boolean




Whether to use the content as indexable text.








-p pinned=boolean




Whether to pin the new revision. A file can have a maximum of 200 pinned revisions.








-p new-revision=boolean




Whether a blob upload should create a new revision. If false, the blob data in the current head revision is replaced. If true or not set, a new blob is created as head revision, and previous unpinned revisions are preserved for a short period of time. Pinned revisions are stored indefinitely, using additional storage quota, up to a maximum of 200 revisions. For details on how revisions are retained, see the Drive Help Center.








-p ocr=boolean




Whether to attempt OCR on .jpg, .png, .gif, or .pdf uploads.








-p ocr-language=string




If ocr is true, hints at the language to use. Valid values are BCP 47 codes.








-p set-modified-date=boolean




Whether to set the modified date with the supplied modified date.








-p remove-parents=string




Comma-separated list of parent IDs to remove.








-p update-viewed-date=boolean




Whether to update the view date after successfully updating the file.








-p add-parents=string




Comma-separated list of parent IDs to add.








Optional General Properties


The following properties can configure any call, and are not specific to this method.






-p alt=string




Data format for the response.








-p fields=string




Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.








-p key=string




API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.








-p oauth-token=string




OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.








-p pretty-print=boolean




Returns response with indentations and line breaks.








-p quota-user=string




Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.








-p user-ip=string




IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.
docs.title: Patch

docs.text:
You will need authorization for at least one of the following scopes to make a valid call:   https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive  https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.appdata  https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.apps.readonly  https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file  https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.metadata  https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.scripts   If unset, the scope for this method defaults to  https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive .
You can set the scope for this method like this:  drive2 --scope  scope  files patch ...

When making a drive.permissions.insert request, exactly one of the id or value fields must be specified unless the permission type is anyone, in which case both id and value are ignored.    kind=eos  This is always drive#permission.    name=nonumy  The name for this permission.    photo-link=sanctus  A link to the profile photo, if available.    role=voluptua.  The primary role for this user. Allowed values are:    owner   reader   writer      self-link=labore  A link back to this permission.    type=erat  The account type. Allowed values are:    user   group   domain   anyone      value=erat  The email address or domain name for the entity. This is used during inserts and is not populated in responses. When making a drive.permissions.insert request, exactly one of the id or value fields must be specified unless the permission type is anyone, in which case both id and value are ignored.     with-link=true   Whether the link is required for this permission.     ..    version=est   A monotonically increasing version number for the file. This reflects every change made to the file on the server, even those not visible to the requesting user.    video-media-metadata    duration-millis=consetetur  The duration of the video in milliseconds.    height=62  The height of the video in pixels.     width=4   The width of the video in pixels.     ..    web-content-link=lorem   A link for downloading the content of the file in a browser using cookie based authentication. In cases where the content is shared publicly, the content can be downloaded without any credentials.    web-view-link=eirmod  A link only available on public folders for viewing their static web assets (HTML, CSS, JS, etc) via Google Drive s Website Hosting.    writers-can-share=true  Whether writers can share the document with other users.

docs.text: The cursor position is key to comfortably set complex nested structures. The following rules apply:   The cursor position is always set relative to the current one, unless the field name starts with the  .  character. Fields can be nested such as in  -r f.s.o  .  The cursor position is set relative to the top-level structure if it starts with  . , e.g.  -r .s.s  You can also set nested fields without setting the cursor explicitly. For example, to set a value relative to the current cursor position, you would specify  -r struct.sub_struct=bar .  You can move the cursor one level up by using  .. . Each additional  .  moves it up one additional level. E.g.  ...  would go three levels up.

You may set the following properties to further configure the call. Please note that  -p  is followed by one 
or more key-value-pairs, and is called like this  -p k1=v1 k2=v2  even though the listing below repeats the -p  for completeness.    -p timed-text-language=string   The language of the timed text.     -p timed-text-track-name=string   The timed text track name.     -p modified-date-behavior=string   Determines the behavior in which modifiedDate is updated. This overrides setModifiedDate.     -p convert=boolean   This parameter is deprecated and has no function.     -p use-content-as-indexable-text=boolean   Whether to use the content as indexable text.     -p pinned=boolean   Whether to pin the new revision. A file can have a maximum of 200 pinned revisions.     -p new-revision=boolean   Whether a blob upload should create a new revision. If false, the blob data in the current head revision is replaced. If true or not set, a new blob is created as head revision, and previous unpinned revisions are preserved for a short period of time. Pinned revisions are stored indefinitely, using additional storage quota, up to a maximum of 200 revisions. For details on how revisions are retained, see the Drive Help Center.     -p ocr=boolean   Whether to attempt OCR on .jpg, .png, .gif, or .pdf uploads.     -p ocr-language=string   If ocr is true, hints at the language to use. Valid values are BCP 47 codes.     -p set-modified-date=boolean   Whether to set the modified date with the supplied modified date.     -p remove-parents=string   Comma-separated list of parent IDs to remove.     -p update-viewed-date=boolean   Whether to update the view date after successfully updating the file.     -p add-parents=string   Comma-separated list of parent IDs to add.

docs.text:
Updates file metadata and/or content.


Scopes


You will need authorization for at least one of the following scopes to make a valid call:




https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.appdata


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.apps.readonly


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.metadata


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.scripts




If unset, the scope for this method defaults to 
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive
.
You can set the scope for this method like this: 
drive2 --scope 
scope
 files update ...


Required Scalar Argument




file-id
 
(string)


The ID of the file to update.








Required Request Value


The request value is a data-structure with various fields. Each field may be a simple scalar or another data-structure.
In the latter case it is advised to set the field-cursor to the data-structure's field to specify values more concisely.


For example, a structure like this:


File:
  alternate-link: string
  app-data-contents: boolean
  can-comment: boolean
  can-read-revisions: boolean
  copyable: boolean
  created-date: string
  default-open-with-link: string
  description: string
  download-url: string
  editable: boolean
  embed-link: string
  etag: string
  explicitly-trashed: boolean
  export-links: { string: string }
  file-extension: string
  file-size: string
  folder-color-rgb: string
  full-file-extension: string
  has-thumbnail: boolean
  head-revision-id: string
  icon-link: string
  id: string
  image-media-metadata:
    aperture: number
    camera-make: string
    camera-model: string
    color-space: string
    date: string
    exposure-bias: number
    exposure-mode: string
    exposure-time: number
    flash-used: boolean
    focal-length: number
    height: integer
    iso-speed: integer
    lens: string
    location:
      altitude: number
      latitude: number
      longitude: number
    max-aperture-value: number
    metering-mode: string
    rotation: integer
    sensor: string
    subject-distance: integer
    white-balance: string
    width: integer
  indexable-text:
    text: string
  is-app-authorized: boolean
  kind: string
  labels:
    hidden: boolean
    modified: boolean
    restricted: boolean
    starred: boolean
    trashed: boolean
    viewed: boolean
  last-modifying-user:
    display-name: string
    email-address: string
    is-authenticated-user: boolean
    kind: string
    permission-id: string
    picture:
      url: string
  last-modifying-user-name: string
  last-viewed-by-me-date: string
  marked-viewed-by-me-date: string
  md5-checksum: string
  mime-type: string
  modified-by-me-date: string
  modified-date: string
  open-with-links: { string: string }
  original-filename: string
  owned-by-me: boolean
  owner-names: [string]
  quota-bytes-used: string
  self-link: string
  shareable: boolean
  shared: boolean
  shared-with-me-date: string
  sharing-user:
    display-name: string
    email-address: string
    is-authenticated-user: boolean
    kind: string
    permission-id: string
    picture:
      url: string
  spaces: [string]
  thumbnail:
    image: string
    mime-type: string
  thumbnail-link: string
  thumbnail-version: string
  title: string
  user-permission:
    additional-roles: [string]
    auth-key: string
    domain: string
    email-address: string
    etag: string
    expiration-date: string
    id: string
    kind: string
    name: string
    photo-link: string
    role: string
    self-link: string
    type: string
    value: string
    with-link: boolean
  version: string
  video-media-metadata:
    duration-millis: string
    height: integer
    width: integer
  web-content-link: string
  web-view-link: string
  writers-can-share: boolean





can be set completely with the following arguments which are assumed to be executed in the given order. Note how the cursor position is adjusted to the respective structures, allowing simple field names to be used most of the time.




-r .    alternate-link=clita


A link for opening the file in a relevant Google editor or viewer.






app-data-contents=true


Whether this file is in the Application Data folder.






can-comment=true


Whether the current user can comment on the file.






can-read-revisions=false


Whether the current user has read access to the Revisions resource of the file.






copyable=false


Whether the file can be copied by the current user.






created-date=sed


Create time for this file (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).






default-open-with-link=sanctus


A link to open this file with the user
s default app for this file. Only populated when the drive.apps.readonly scope is used.






description=sea


A short description of the file.






download-url=ipsum


No description provided.






editable=false


Whether the file can be edited by the current user.






embed-link=eos


A link for embedding the file.






etag=sed


ETag of the file.






explicitly-trashed=false


Whether this file has been explicitly trashed, as opposed to recursively trashed.






export-links=key=eirmod


Links for exporting Google Docs to specific formats.


the value will be associated with the given 
key






file-extension=stet


The final component of fullFileExtension with trailing text that does not appear to be part of the extension removed. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






file-size=sea


The size of the file in bytes. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






folder-color-rgb=sanctus


Folder color as an RGB hex string if the file is a folder. The list of supported colors is available in the folderColorPalette field of the About resource. If an unsupported color is specified, it will be changed to the closest color in the palette.






full-file-extension=gubergren


The full file extension; extracted from the title. May contain multiple concatenated extensions, such as 
tar.gz
. Removing an extension from the title does not clear this field; however, changing the extension on the title does update this field. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






has-thumbnail=false


Whether this file has a thumbnail.






head-revision-id=invidunt


The ID of the file
s head revision. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






icon-link=voluptua.


A link to the file
s icon.






id=erat


The ID of the file.






image-media-metadata    aperture=0.517655314383


The aperture used to create the photo (f-number).






camera-make=no


The make of the camera used to create the photo.






camera-model=vero


The model of the camera used to create the photo.






color-space=sed


The color space of the photo.






date=vero


The date and time the photo was taken (EXIF format timestamp).






exposure-bias=0.176816039307


The exposure bias of the photo (APEX value).






exposure-mode=lorem


The exposure mode used to create the photo.






exposure-time=0.638046899902


The length of the exposure, in seconds.






flash-used=false


Whether a flash was used to create the photo.






focal-length=0.0275602164808


The focal length used to create the photo, in millimeters.






height=28


The height of the image in pixels.






iso-speed=22


The ISO speed used to create the photo.






lens=dolor


The lens used to create the photo.






location    altitude=0.110394003614


The altitude stored in the image.






latitude=0.049386894448


The latitude stored in the image.








longitude=0.01341631099




The longitude stored in the image.








..    max-aperture-value=0.232419896913




The smallest f-number of the lens at the focal length used to create the photo (APEX value).






metering-mode=eirmod


The metering mode used to create the photo.






rotation=58


The rotation in clockwise degrees from the image
s original orientation.






sensor=accusam


The type of sensor used to create the photo.






subject-distance=44


The distance to the subject of the photo, in meters.






white-balance=dolor


The white balance mode used to create the photo.








width=2




The width of the image in pixels.








..indexable-text    text=dolore




The text to be indexed for this file.








..    is-app-authorized=false




Whether the file was created or opened by the requesting app.






kind=ipsum


The type of file. This is always drive#file.






labels    hidden=true


Deprecated.






modified=true


Whether the file has been modified by this user.






restricted=true


Whether viewers and commenters are prevented from downloading, printing, and copying this file.






starred=true


Whether this file is starred by the user.






trashed=true


Whether this file has been trashed. This label applies to all users accessing the file; however, only owners are allowed to see and untrash files.








viewed=true




Whether this file has been viewed by this user.








..last-modifying-user    display-name=invidunt




A plain text displayable name for this user.






email-address=amet


The email address of the user.






is-authenticated-user=false


Whether this user is the same as the authenticated user for whom the request was made.






kind=voluptua.


This is always drive#user.






permission-id=et


The user
s ID as visible in the permissions collection.








picture    url=elitr




A URL that points to a profile picture of this user.








...    last-modifying-user-name=kasd




Name of the last user to modify this file.






last-viewed-by-me-date=sit


Last time this file was viewed by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).






marked-viewed-by-me-date=justo


Deprecated.






md5-checksum=gubergren


An MD5 checksum for the content of this file. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.






mime-type=ipsum


The MIME type of the file. This is only mutable on update when uploading new content. This field can be left blank, and the mimetype will be determined from the uploaded content
s MIME type.






modified-by-me-date=amet.


Last time this file was modified by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). Note that setting modifiedDate will also update the modifiedByMe date for the user which set the date.






modified-date=dolor


Last time this file was modified by anyone (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). This is only mutable on update when the setModifiedDate parameter is set.






open-with-links=key=sanctus


A map of the id of each of the user
s apps to a link to open this file with that app. Only populated when the drive.apps.readonly scope is used.


the value will be associated with the given 
key






original-filename=ut


The original filename of the uploaded content if available, or else the original value of the title field. This is only available for files with binary content in Drive.






owned-by-me=true


Whether the file is owned by the current user.






owner-names=amet.


Name(s) of the owner(s) of this file.


Each invocation of this argument appends the given value to the array.






quota-bytes-used=eirmod


The number of quota bytes used by this file.






self-link=ea


A link back to this file.






shareable=true


Whether the file
s sharing settings can be modified by the current user.






shared=true


Whether the file has been shared.






shared-with-me-date=sanctus


Time at which this file was shared with the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).






sharing-user    display-name=diam


A plain text displayable name for this user.






email-address=eos


The email address of the user.






is-authenticated-user=true


Whether this user is the same as the authenticated user for whom the request was made.






kind=sea


This is always drive#user.






permission-id=ea


The user
s ID as visible in the permissions collection.








picture    url=nonumy




A URL that points to a profile picture of this user.








...    spaces=duo




The list of spaces which contain the file. Supported values are 
drive
, 
appDataFolder
 and 
photos
.


Each invocation of this argument appends the given value to the array.






thumbnail    image=tempor


The URL-safe Base64 encoded bytes of the thumbnail image. It should conform to RFC 4648 section 5.








mime-type=consetetur




The MIME type of the thumbnail.








..    thumbnail-link=eirmod




A short-lived link to the file
s thumbnail. Typically lasts on the order of hours. Only populated when the requesting app can access the file
s content.






thumbnail-version=aliquyam


The thumbnail version for use in client-contructable thumbnail URLs or thumbnail cache invalidation.






title=no


The title of this file.






user-permission    additional-roles=aliquyam


Additional roles for this user. Only commenter is currently allowed.


Each invocation of this argument appends the given value to the array.






auth-key=accusam


The authkey parameter required for this permission.






domain=sed


The domain name of the entity this permission refers to. This is an output-only field which is present when the permission type is user, group or domain.






email-address=sea


The email address of the user or group this permission refers to. This is an output-only field which is present when the permission type is user or group.






etag=amet.


The ETag of the permission.






expiration-date=clita


The time at which this permission will expire (RFC 3339 date-time).






id=clita


The ID of the user this permission refers to, and identical to the permissionId in the About and Files resources. When making a drive.permissions.insert request, exactly one of the id or value fields must be specified unless the permission type is anyone, in which case both id and value are ignored.






kind=est


This is always drive#permission.






name=sit


The name for this permission.






photo-link=ipsum


A link to the profile photo, if available.






role=dolore


The primary role for this user. Allowed values are:  


owner 


reader 


writer










self-link=sadipscing


A link back to this permission.

The account type. Allowed values are:  


user 


group 


domain 


anyone










value=sadipscing


The email address or domain name for the entity. This is used during inserts and is not populated in responses. When making a drive.permissions.insert request, exactly one of the id or value fields must be specified unless the permission type is anyone, in which case both id and value are ignored.








with-link=true




Whether the link is required for this permission.








..    version=dolor




A monotonically increasing version number for the file. This reflects every change made to the file on the server, even those not visible to the requesting user.






video-media-metadata    duration-millis=consetetur


The duration of the video in milliseconds.






height=6


The height of the video in pixels.








width=52




The width of the video in pixels.








..    web-content-link=et




A link for downloading the content of the file in a browser using cookie based authentication. In cases where the content is shared publicly, the content can be downloaded without any credentials.






web-view-link=invidunt


A link only available on public folders for viewing their static web assets (HTML, CSS, JS, etc) via Google Drive
s Website Hosting.






writers-can-share=true


Whether writers can share the document with other users.








About Cursors


The cursor position is key to comfortably set complex nested structures. The following rules apply:




The cursor position is always set relative to the current one, unless the field name starts with the 
.
 character. Fields can be nested such as in 
-r f.s.o
 .


The cursor position is set relative to the top-level structure if it starts with 
.
, e.g. 
-r .s.s


You can also set nested fields without setting the cursor explicitly. For example, to set a value relative to the current cursor position, you would specify 
-r struct.sub_struct=bar
.


You can move the cursor one level up by using 
..
. Each additional 
.
 moves it up one additional level. E.g. 
...
 would go three levels up.




Required Upload Flags


This method supports the upload of data, which 
requires
 all of the following flags to be set:




-u (simple|resumable)


simple
 - Upload media all at once.


resumable
 - Upload media in a resumable fashion.






-f file


Path to file to upload. It must be seekable.








The following flag 
may
 be set: 




-m mime


the mime type, like 'application/octet-stream', which is the default








Optional Output Flags


The method's return value a JSON encoded structure, which will be written to standard output by default.




-o out


out
 specifies the 
destination
 to which to write the server's result to.
  It will be a JSON-encoded structure.
  The 
destination
 may be 
-
 to indicate standard output, or a filepath that is to contain the received bytes.
  If unset, it defaults to standard output.








Optional Method Properties


You may set the following properties to further configure the call. Please note that 
-p
 is followed by one 
or more key-value-pairs, and is called like this 
-p k1=v1 k2=v2
 even though the listing below repeats the

-p
 for completeness.






-p timed-text-language=string




The language of the timed text.








-p timed-text-track-name=string




The timed text track name.








-p modified-date-behavior=string




Determines the behavior in which modifiedDate is updated. This overrides setModifiedDate.








-p ocr=boolean




Whether to attempt OCR on .jpg, .png, .gif, or .pdf uploads.








-p remove-parents=string




Comma-separated list of parent IDs to remove.








-p pinned=boolean




Whether to pin the new revision. A file can have a maximum of 200 pinned revisions.








-p new-revision=boolean




Whether a blob upload should create a new revision. If false, the blob data in the current head revision is replaced. If true or not set, a new blob is created as head revision, and previous unpinned revisions are preserved for a short period of time. Pinned revisions are stored indefinitely, using additional storage quota, up to a maximum of 200 revisions. For details on how revisions are retained, see the Drive Help Center.








-p convert=boolean




This parameter is deprecated and has no function.








-p ocr-language=string




If ocr is true, hints at the language to use. Valid values are BCP 47 codes.








-p use-content-as-indexable-text=boolean




Whether to use the content as indexable text.








-p set-modified-date=boolean




Whether to set the modified date with the supplied modified date.








-p update-viewed-date=boolean




Whether to update the view date after successfully updating the file.








-p add-parents=string




Comma-separated list of parent IDs to add.








Optional General Properties


The following properties can configure any call, and are not specific to this method.






-p alt=string




Data format for the response.








-p fields=string




Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.








-p key=string




API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.








-p oauth-token=string




OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.








-p pretty-print=boolean




Returns response with indentations and line breaks.








-p quota-user=string




Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.








-p user-ip=string




IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

You will need authorization for at least one of the following scopes to make a valid call:   https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive  https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.appdata  https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.apps.readonly  https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file  https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.metadata  https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.scripts   If unset, the scope for this method defaults to  https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive .
You can set the scope for this method like this:  drive2 --scope  scope  files update ...

A link to the file s icon.    id=erat  The ID of the file.    image-media-metadata    aperture=0.517655314383  The aperture used to create the photo (f-number).    camera-make=no  The make of the camera used to create the photo.    camera-model=vero  The model of the camera used to create the photo.    color-space=sed  The color space of the photo.    date=vero  The date and time the photo was taken (EXIF format timestamp).    exposure-bias=0.176816039307  The exposure bias of the photo (APEX value).    exposure-mode=lorem  The exposure mode used to create the photo.    exposure-time=0.638046899902  The length of the exposure, in seconds.    flash-used=false  Whether a flash was used to create the photo.    focal-length=0.0275602164808  The focal length used to create the photo, in millimeters.    height=28  The height of the image in pixels.    iso-speed=22  The ISO speed used to create the photo.    lens=dolor  The lens used to create the photo.    location    altitude=0.110394003614  The altitude stored in the image.    latitude=0.049386894448  The latitude stored in the image.     longitude=0.01341631099   The longitude stored in the image.     ..    max-aperture-value=0.232419896913   The smallest f-number of the lens at the focal length used to create the photo (APEX value).    metering-mode=eirmod  The metering mode used to create the photo.    rotation=58  The rotation in clockwise degrees from the image s original orientation.    sensor=accusam  The type of sensor used to create the photo.    subject-distance=44  The distance to the subject of the photo, in meters.    white-balance=dolor  The white balance mode used to create the photo.     width=2   The width of the image in pixels.     ..indexable-text    text=dolore   The text to be indexed for this file.     ..    is-app-authorized=false   Whether the file was created or opened by the requesting app.    kind=ipsum  The type of file. Last time this file was modified by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). Note that setting modifiedDate will also update the modifiedByMe date for the user which set the date.    modified-date=dolor  Last time this file was modified by anyone (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). Each invocation of this argument appends the given value to the array.    quota-bytes-used=eirmod  The number of quota bytes used by this file.    self-link=ea  A link back to this file.    shareable=true  Whether the file s sharing settings can be modified by the current user.    shared=true  Whether the file has been shared.    shared-with-me-date=sanctus  Time at which this file was shared with the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).    sharing-user    display-name=diam  A plain text displayable name for this user.    email-address=eos  The email address of the user.    is-authenticated-user=true  Whether this user is the same as the authenticated user for whom the request was made.    kind=sea  This is always drive#user.    permission-id=ea  The user s ID as visible in the permissions collection.     picture    url=nonumy   A URL that points to a profile picture of this user.     ...    spaces=duo   The list of spaces which contain the file. docs.text:
Subscribe to changes on a file


Scopes


You will need authorization for at least one of the following scopes to make a valid call:




https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.appdata


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.metadata


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.metadata.readonly


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.photos.readonly


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.readonly




If unset, the scope for this method defaults to 
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive
.
You can set the scope for this method like this: 
drive2 --scope 
scope
 files watch ...


Required Scalar Argument




file-id
 
(string)


The ID for the file in question.








Required Request Value


The request value is a data-structure with various fields. Each field may be a simple scalar or another data-structure.
In the latter case it is advised to set the field-cursor to the data-structure's field to specify values more concisely.


For example, a structure like this:


Channel:
  address: string
  expiration: string
  id: string
  kind: string
  params: { string: string }
  payload: boolean
  resource-id: string
  resource-uri: string
  token: string
  type: string





can be set completely with the following arguments which are assumed to be executed in the given order. Note how the cursor position is adjusted to the respective structures, allowing simple field names to be used most of the time.




-r .    address=sit


The address where notifications are delivered for this channel.






expiration=dolor


Date and time of notification channel expiration, expressed as a Unix timestamp, in milliseconds. Optional.






id=et


A UUID or similar unique string that identifies this channel.






kind=amet


Identifies this as a notification channel used to watch for changes to a resource. Value: the fixed string 
api#channel
.






params=key=sit

docs.text:
Inserts a permission for a file.


Scopes


You will need authorization for at least one of the following scopes to make a valid call:




https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file




If unset, the scope for this method defaults to 
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive
.
You can set the scope for this method like this: 
drive2 --scope 
scope
 permissions insert ...


Required Scalar Argument




file-id
 
(string)


The ID for the file.








Required Request Value


The request value is a data-structure with various fields. Each field may be a simple scalar or another data-structure.
In the latter case it is advised to set the field-cursor to the data-structure's field to specify values more concisely.


For example, a structure like this:


Permission:
  additional-roles: [string]
  auth-key: string
  domain: string
  email-address: string
  etag: string
  expiration-date: string
  id: string
  kind: string
  name: string
  photo-link: string
  role: string
  self-link: string
  type: string
  value: string
  with-link: boolean





can be set completely with the following arguments which are assumed to be executed in the given order. Note how the cursor position is adjusted to the respective structures, allowing simple field names to be used most of the time.




-r .    additional-roles=tempor


Additional roles for this user. Only commenter is currently allowed.


Each invocation of this argument appends the given value to the array.






auth-key=ut


The authkey parameter required for this permission.






domain=kasd


The domain name of the entity this permission refers to. This is an output-only field which is present when the permission type is user, group or domain.






email-address=diam


The email address of the user or group this permission refers to. This is an output-only field which is present when the permission type is user or group.






etag=ut


The ETag of the permission.






expiration-date=diam


The time at which this permission will expire (RFC 3339 date-time).






id=eos


The ID of the user this permission refers to, and identical to the permissionId in the About and Files resources. When making a drive.permissions.insert request, exactly one of the id or value fields must be specified unless the permission type is anyone, in which case both id and value are ignored.






kind=elitr


This is always drive#permission.






name=tempor


The name for this permission.






photo-link=ipsum


A link to the profile photo, if available.






role=no


The primary role for this user. Allowed values are:  


owner 


reader 


writer










self-link=takimata


A link back to this permission.






type=takimata


The account type. Allowed values are:  


user 


group 


domain 


anyone










value=gubergren


The email address or domain name for the entity. This is used during inserts and is not populated in responses. When making a drive.permissions.insert request, exactly one of the id or value fields must be specified unless the permission type is anyone, in which case both id and value are ignored.






with-link=true


Whether the link is required for this permission.








About Cursors


The cursor position is key to comfortably set complex nested structures. The following rules apply:




The cursor position is always set relative to the current one, unless the field name starts with the 
.
 character. Fields can be nested such as in 
-r f.s.o
 .


The cursor position is set relative to the top-level structure if it starts with 
.
, e.g. 
-r .s.s


You can also set nested fields without setting the cursor explicitly. For example, to set a value relative to the current cursor position, you would specify 
-r struct.sub_struct=bar
.


You can move the cursor one level up by using 
..
. Each additional 
.
 moves it up one additional level. E.g. 
...
 would go three levels up.

destination
 to which to write the server's result to.
  It will be a JSON-encoded structure.

destination

 to indicate standard output, or a filepath that is to contain the received bytes.
  If unset, it defaults to standard output.

Updates a permission.


Scopes


You will need authorization for at least one of the following scopes to make a valid call:




https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive

If unset, the scope for this method defaults to

.
You can set the scope for this method like this: 
drive2 --scope 
scope
 permissions update ...


Required Scalar Arguments




file-id
 
(string)


The ID for the file.






permission-id
 
(string)


The ID for the permission.








Required Request Value


The request value is a data-structure with various fields. Each field may be a simple scalar or another data-structure.
In the latter case it is advised to set the field-cursor to the data-structure's field to specify values more concisely.


For example, a structure like this:


Permission:
  additional-roles: [string]
  auth-key: string
  domain: string
  email-address: string
  etag: string
  expiration-date: string
  id: string
  kind: string
  name: string
  photo-link: string
  role: string
  self-link: string
  type: string
  value: string
  with-link: boolean





can be set completely with the following arguments which are assumed to be executed in the given order. Note how the cursor position is adjusted to the respective structures, allowing simple field names to be used most of the time.




-r .    additional-roles=sit


Additional roles for this user. Only commenter is currently allowed.


Each invocation of this argument appends the given value to the array.






auth-key=lorem


The authkey parameter required for this permission.






domain=sanctus


The domain name of the entity this permission refers to. This is an output-only field which is present when the permission type is user, group or domain.






email-address=accusam


The email address of the user or group this permission refers to. This is an output-only field which is present when the permission type is user or group.






etag=dolore


The ETag of the permission.






expiration-date=est


The time at which this permission will expire (RFC 3339 date-time).






id=invidunt


The ID of the user this permission refers to, and identical to the permissionId in the About and Files resources. When making a drive.permissions.insert request, exactly one of the id or value fields must be specified unless the permission type is anyone, in which case both id and value are ignored.






kind=accusam


This is always drive#permission.






name=accusam


The name for this permission.






photo-link=invidunt


A link to the profile photo, if available.






role=eirmod


The primary role for this user. Allowed values are:  


owner 


reader 


writer










self-link=sit


A link back to this permission.






type=elitr


The account type. Allowed values are:  


user 


group 


domain 


anyone










value=amet


The email address or domain name for the entity. This is used during inserts and is not populated in responses. When making a drive.permissions.insert request, exactly one of the id or value fields must be specified unless the permission type is anyone, in which case both id and value are ignored.






with-link=false


Whether the link is required for this permission.








About Cursors


The cursor position is key to comfortably set complex nested structures. The following rules apply:




The cursor position is always set relative to the current one, unless the field name starts with the 
.
 character. Fields can be nested such as in 
-r f.s.o

The cursor position is set relative to the top-level structure if it starts with 
.
, e.g. 
-r .s.s


You can also set nested fields without setting the cursor explicitly. For example, to set a value relative to the current cursor position, you would specify 
-r struct.sub_struct=bar
.


You can move the cursor one level up by using 
..
. Each additional 
.
 moves it up one additional level. E.g. 
...
 would go three levels up.

The method's return value a JSON encoded structure, which will be written to standard output by default.

out
 specifies the 
destination
 to which to write the server's result to.
  It will be a JSON-encoded structure.
  The 
destination

-
 to indicate standard output, or a filepath that is to contain the received bytes.
  If unset, it defaults to standard output.

The request value is a data-structure with various fields. Each field may be a simple scalar or another data-structure.
In the latter case it is advised to set the field-cursor to the data-structure's field to specify values more concisely.  For example, a structure like this:  Property:
  etag: string
  key: string
  kind: string
  self-link: string
  value: string
  visibility: string  can be set completely with the following arguments which are assumed to be executed in the given order. Note how the cursor position is adjusted to the respective structures, allowing simple field names to be used most of the time.   -r .    etag=duo  ETag of the property.    key=et  The key of this property.    kind=est  This is always drive#property.    self-link=et  The link back to this property.    value=et  The value of this property.    visibility=clita  The visibility of this property.

The following rules apply:   The cursor position is always set relative to the current one, unless the field name starts with the  .  character. Fields can be nested such as in  -r f.s.o  .  The cursor position is set relative to the top-level structure if it starts with  . , e.g.  -r .s.s  You can also set nested fields without setting the cursor explicitly. For example, to set a value relative to the current cursor position, you would specify  -r struct.sub_struct=bar .  You can move the cursor one level up by using  .. . Each additional  .  moves it up one additional level. E.g.  ...  would go three levels up.

docs.text:
Updates a property, or adds it if it doesn
t exist. This method supports patch semantics.


Scopes


You will need authorization for at least one of the following scopes to make a valid call:




https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.appdata


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.metadata




If unset, the scope for this method defaults to 
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive
.
You can set the scope for this method like this: 
drive2 --scope 
scope
 properties patch ...


Required Scalar Arguments




file-id
 
(string)


The ID of the file.






property-key
 
(string)


The key of the property.








Required Request Value


The request value is a data-structure with various fields. Each field may be a simple scalar or another data-structure.
In the latter case it is advised to set the field-cursor to the data-structure's field to specify values more concisely.


For example, a structure like this:


Property:
  etag: string
  key: string
  kind: string
  self-link: string
  value: string
  visibility: string





can be set completely with the following arguments which are assumed to be executed in the given order. Note how the cursor position is adjusted to the respective structures, allowing simple field names to be used most of the time.




-r .    etag=consetetur


ETag of the property.






key=magna


The key of this property.






kind=invidunt


This is always drive#property.






self-link=at


The link back to this property.






value=rebum.


The value of this property.






visibility=sit


The visibility of this property.








About Cursors


The cursor position is key to comfortably set complex nested structures. The following rules apply:




The cursor position is always set relative to the current one, unless the field name starts with the 
.
 character. Fields can be nested such as in 
-r f.s.o
 .


The cursor position is set relative to the top-level structure if it starts with 
.
, e.g. 
-r .s.s


You can also set nested fields without setting the cursor explicitly. For example, to set a value relative to the current cursor position, you would specify 
-r struct.sub_struct=bar
.


You can move the cursor one level up by using 
..
. Each additional 
.
 moves it up one additional level. E.g. 
...
 would go three levels up.




Optional Output Flags


The method's return value a JSON encoded structure, which will be written to standard output by default.




-o out


out
 specifies the 
destination
 to which to write the server's result to.
  It will be a JSON-encoded structure.
  The 
destination
 may be 
-
 to indicate standard output, or a filepath that is to contain the received bytes.
  If unset, it defaults to standard output.

You may set the following properties to further configure the call. Please note that 
-p
 is followed by one 
or more key-value-pairs, and is called like this 
-p k1=v1 k2=v2
 even though the listing below repeats the

-p
 for completeness.

The visibility of the property.

If unset, the scope for this method defaults to

.
You can set the scope for this method like this: 
drive2 --scope 
scope
 realtime get ...


Required Scalar Argument

(string)


The ID of the file that the Realtime API data model is associated with.








Optional Output Flags

-o out


out
 specifies the 
destination
 to which to write the server's result to.

  The 
destination

 to indicate standard output, or a filepath that is to contain the received bytes.
  If unset, it defaults to standard output.

You may set the following properties to further configure the call. Please note that 
-p

or more key-value-pairs, and is called like this 
-p k1=v1 k2=v2
 even though the listing below repeats the

 for completeness.




-p revision=integer


The revision of the Realtime API data model to export. Revisions start at 1 (the initial empty data model) and are incremented with each change. If this parameter is excluded, the most recent data model will be returned.

Overwrites the Realtime API data model associated with this file with the provided JSON data model.


Scopes


You will need authorization for at least one of the following scopes to make a valid call:




https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive


https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file




If unset, the scope for this method defaults to 
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive
.
You can set the scope for this method like this: 
drive2 --scope 
scope
 realtime update ...


Required Scalar Argument




file-id
 
(string)


The ID of the file that the Realtime API data model is associated with.








Required Upload Flags


This method supports the upload of data, which 
requires
 all of the following flags to be set:




-u (simple|resumable)


simple
 - Upload media all at once.


resumable
 - Upload media in a resumable fashion.






-f file


Path to file to upload. It must be seekable.








The following flag 
may
 be set: 




-m mime


the mime type, like 'application/octet-stream', which is the default








Optional Method Properties


You may set the following properties to further configure the call. Please note that 
-p
 is followed by one 
or more key-value-pairs, and is called like this 
-p k1=v1 k2=v2
 even though the listing below repeats the

Scopes

.

drive2 --scope 
scope

Required Scalar Arguments




file-id
 
(string)


The ID of the file.






comment-id
 
(string)


The ID of the comment.








Required Request Value


The request value is a data-structure with various fields. Each field may be a simple scalar or another data-structure.
In the latter case it is advised to set the field-cursor to the data-structure's field to specify values more concisely.


For example, a structure like this:


CommentReply:
  author:
    display-name: string
    email-address: string
    is-authenticated-user: boolean
    kind: string
    permission-id: string
    picture:
      url: string
  content: string
  created-date: string
  deleted: boolean
  html-content: string
  kind: string
  modified-date: string
  reply-id: string
  verb: string





can be set completely with the following arguments which are assumed to be executed in the given order. Note how the cursor position is adjusted to the respective structures, allowing simple field names to be used most of the time.




-r .author    display-name=tempor


A plain text displayable name for this user.






email-address=sed


The email address of the user.






is-authenticated-user=false


Whether this user is the same as the authenticated user for whom the request was made.






kind=at


This is always drive#user.






permission-id=dolor


The user
s ID as visible in the permissions collection.








picture    url=vero




A URL that points to a profile picture of this user.








...    content=erat




The plain text content used to create this reply. This is not HTML safe and should only be used as a starting point to make edits to a reply
s content. This field is required on inserts if no verb is specified (resolve/reopen).






created-date=dolore


The date when this reply was first created.






deleted=true


Whether this reply has been deleted. If a reply has been deleted the content will be cleared and this will only represent a reply that once existed.






html-content=stet


HTML formatted content for this reply.






kind=et


This is always drive#commentReply.






modified-date=labore


The date when this reply was last modified.






reply-id=amet


The ID of the reply.






verb=invidunt


The action this reply performed to the parent comment. When creating a new reply this is the action to be perform to the parent comment. Possible values are:  


resolve
 - To resolve a comment. 


reopen
 - To reopen (un-resolve) a comment.












About Cursors


The cursor position is key to comfortably set complex nested structures. The following rules apply:




The cursor position is always set relative to the current one, unless the field name starts with the

You can also set nested fields without setting the cursor explicitly. For example, to set a value relative to the current cursor position, you would specify 
-r struct.sub_struct=bar
.


You can move the cursor one level up by using 
..
. Each additional 
.
 moves it up one additional level. E.g. 
...
 would go three levels up.
